   11: %%

   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   14: %% WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
   15: %% See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
   16: %% limitations under the License.
   17: %%

   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of diameter_tcp/sctp as implementations of the diameter
   23: %% transport interface.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_transport_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          parallel/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([accept/1,
   37:          connect/1,
   38:          reconnect/1,
   39:          init/2]).
   40: 
   41: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
   42: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   43: 
   44: -define(util, diameter_util).
   45: 
   46: %% Corresponding to diameter_* transport modules.
   47: -define(TRANSPORTS, [tcp, sctp]).
   48: 
   49: %% Receive a message.
   50: -define(RECV(Pat, Ret), receive Pat -> Ret end).
   51: -define(RECV(Pat), ?RECV(Pat, diameter_lib:now())).
   52: 
   53: %% Sockets are opened on the loopback address.
   54: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   55: 
   56: %% diameter_tcp doesn't use anything but host_ip_address, and that
   57: %% only is a local address isn't configured as at transport start.
   58: -define(SVC(Addrs), #diameter_service{capabilities
   59:                                       = #diameter_caps{host_ip_address
   60:                                                        = Addrs}}).
   61: 
   62: %% The term we register after open a listening port with gen_{tcp,sctp}.
   63: -define(TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr),
   64:         {?MODULE, listen, Ref, PortNr}).
   65: 
   66: %% Message over the transport interface.
   67: -define(TMSG(T), {diameter, T}).
   68: 
   69: %% Options for gen_tcp/gen_sctp.
   70: -define(TCP_OPTS,  [binary, {active, true}, {packet, 0}]).
   71: -define(SCTP_OPTS, [binary, {active, true}, {sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT}]).
   72: 
   73: %% Request a specific number of streams just because we can.
   74: -define(SCTP_INIT, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = 5,
   75:                                  max_instreams = 5}).
   76: 
   77: %% Messages from gen_sctp.
   78: -define(SCTP(Sock, Data), {sctp, Sock, _, _, Data}).
   79: 
   80: %% ===========================================================================
   81: %% common_test wrapping
   82: 
   83: suite() ->
   84:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 270}}].
   85: 
   86: all() ->
   87:     [parallel].
   88: 
   89: parallel(_) ->
   90:     run().
   91: 
   92: %% ===========================================================================
   93: 
   94: %% run/0
   95: 
   96: run() ->
   97:     ok = diameter:start(),
   98:     try
   99:         ?util:run([[fun run/1, {P,F}]
  100:                    || P <- [sctp || ?util:have_sctp()] ++ [tcp],
  101:                       F <- [connect, accept, reconnect]])
  102:     after
  103:         diameter:stop()
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: %% run/1
  107: 
  108: run({Prot, reconnect}) ->
  109:     reconnect(Prot);
  110: 
  111: run({Prot, accept}) ->
  112:     accept(Prot);
  113: 
  114: run({Prot, connect}) ->
  115:     connect(Prot).
  116: 
  117: %% ===========================================================================
  118: %% accept/1
  119: %%
  120: %% diameter transport accepting, test code connecting.
  121: 
  122: accept(Prot) ->
  123:     Ref = make_ref(),
  124:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({diameter_config, transport, Ref}), %% fake it
  125:     T = {Prot, Ref},
  126:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  127:                || X <- [accept, gen_connect]]).
  128: 
  129: %% ===========================================================================
  130: %% connect/1
  131: %%
  132: %% Test code accepting, diameter transport connecting.
  133: 
  134: connect(Prot) ->
  135:     T = {Prot, make_ref()},
  136:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  137:                || X <- [gen_accept, connect]]).
  138: 
  139: %% ===========================================================================
  140: %% reconnect/1
  141: %%
  142: %% Exercise reconnection behaviour: that a connecting transport
  143: %% doesn't try to establish a new connection until the old one is
  144: %% broken.
  145: 
  146: reconnect({listen, Ref}) ->
  147:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  148:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  149:     LRef = ?util:listen(SvcName, tcp, [{watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  150:     [_] = diameter_reg:wait({diameter_tcp, listener, {LRef, '_'}}),
  151:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({?MODULE, Ref, LRef}),
  152: 
  153:     %% Wait for partner to request transport death.
  154:     TPid = abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref),
  155: 
  156:     %% Kill transport to force the peer to reconnect.
  157:     exit(TPid, kill),
  158: 
  159:     %% Wait for the partner again.
  160:     abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref);
  161: 
  162: reconnect({connect, Ref}) ->
  163:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  164:     true = diameter:subscribe(SvcName),
  165:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  166:     [{{_, _, LRef}, Pid}] = diameter_reg:wait({?MODULE, Ref, '_'}),
  167:     CRef = ?util:connect(SvcName, tcp, LRef, [{connect_timer, 2000},
  168:                                               {watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  169: 
  170:     %% Tell partner to kill transport after seeing that there are no
  171:     %% reconnection attempts.
  172:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  173: 
  174:     %% Transport goes down and is reestablished.
  175:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {down, CRef, _, _}}),
  176:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, CRef, _}}),
  177:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {up, CRef, _, _, _}}),
  178: 
  179:     %% Kill again.
  180:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  181: 
  182:     %% Wait for partner to die.
  183:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  184:     ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _});
  185: 
  186: reconnect(Prot) ->
  187:     Ref = make_ref(),
  188:     ?util:run([{{?MODULE, [reconnect, {T, Ref}]}, 240000}
  189:                || Prot == tcp,  %% ignore sctp
  190:                   T <- [listen, connect]]).
  191: 
  192: start_service(SvcName) ->
  193:     OH = diameter_util:unique_string(),
  194:     Opts = [{application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  195:                            {module, diameter_callback}]},
  196:             {'Origin-Host', OH},
  197:             {'Origin-Realm', OH ++ ".org"},
  198:             {'Vendor-Id', 0},
  199:             {'Product-Name', "x"},
  200:             {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]}],
  201:     diameter:start_service(SvcName, Opts).
  202: 
  203: abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref)
  204:   when is_pid(Pid) ->
  205:     receive
  206:         #diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, _, _}} = E ->
  207:             erlang:error(E)
  208:     after 45000 ->
  209:             ok
  210:     end,
  211:     Pid ! {abort, Ref};
  212: 
  213: abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref)
  214:   when is_reference(LRef) ->
  215:     ?RECV({abort, Ref}),
  216:     [[{ref, LRef}, {type, listen}, {options, _}, {accept, [_,_] = Ts} | _]]
  217:                                                  %% assert on two accepting
  218:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  219:     [TPid] = [P || [{watchdog, {_,_,okay}}, {peer, {P,_}} | _] <- Ts],
  220:     TPid.
  221: 
  222: %% ===========================================================================
  223: %% ===========================================================================
  224: 
  225: %% init/2
  226: 
  227: init(accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  228:     %% Start an accepting transport and receive notification of a
  229:     %% connection.
  230:     TPid = start_accept(Prot, Ref),
  231: 
  232:     %% Receive a message and send it back.
  233:     <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)),
  234: 
  235:     Len = size(Bin),
  236:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  237: 
  238:     %% Expect the transport process to die as a result of the peer
  239:     %% closing the connection.
  240:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, TPid),
  241:     ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _});
  242: 
  243: init(gen_connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  244:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  245:     [PortNr] = ?util:lport(Prot, Ref),
  246: 
  247:     %% Connect, send a message and receive it back.
  248:     {ok, Sock} = gen_connect(Prot, PortNr),
  249:     Bin = make_msg(),
  250:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  251:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock);
  252: 
  253: init(gen_accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  254:     %% Open a listening socket and publish the port number.
  255:     {ok, LSock} = gen_listen(Prot),
  256:     {ok, PortNr} = inet:port(LSock),
  257:     true = diameter_reg:add_new(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr)),
  258: 
  259:     %% Accept a connection, receive a message send it back, and wait
  260:     %% for the peer to close the connection.
  261:     {ok, Sock} = gen_accept(Prot, LSock),
  262:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock),
  263:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  264:     receive
  265:         {tcp_closed, Sock} = T ->
  266:             T;
  267:         ?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{}}) = T ->
  268:             T
  269:     end;
  270: 
  271: init(connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  272:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  273:     [{?TEST_LISTENER(_, PortNr), _}]
  274:         = diameter_reg:wait(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, '_')),
  275: 
  276:     %% Start a connecting transport and receive notification of
  277:     %% the connection.
  278:     TPid = start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref),
  279: 
  280:     %% Send a message and receive it back.
  281:     Bin = make_msg(),
  282:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  283:     Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)).
  284: 
  285: bin(sctp, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}) ->
  286:     Bin;
  287: bin(tcp, Bin) ->
  288:     Bin.
  289: 
  290: %% make_msg/0
  291: %%
  292: %% A valid Diameter message in as far as diameter_tcp examines it,
  293: %% the module examining the length in the Diameter header to locate
  294: %% message boundaries.
  295: 
  296: make_msg() ->
  297:     N = 1024,
  298:     Bin = rand_bytes(4*N),
  299:     Len = 4*(N+1),
  300:     <<1:8, Len:24, Bin/binary>>.
  301: 
  302: %% crypto:rand_bytes/1 isn't available on all platforms (since openssl
  303: %% isn't) so roll our own. Not particularly random, but less verbose
  304: %% in trace.
  305: rand_bytes(N) ->
  306:     Oct = rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  307:     binary:copy(<<Oct>>, N).
  308: 
  309: %% ===========================================================================
  310: 
  311: %% start_connect/3
  312: 
  313: start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref) ->
  314:     {ok, TPid} = start_connect(Prot,
  315:                                {connect, Ref},
  316:                                ?SVC([]),
  317:                                [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  318:                                 {rport, PortNr},
  319:                                 {ip, ?ADDR},
  320:                                 {port, 0}]),
  321:     connected(Prot, TPid),
  322:     TPid.
  323: 
  324: connected(sctp, TPid) ->
  325:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _}));
  326: connected(tcp, TPid) ->
  327:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _, [?ADDR]})).
  328: 
  329: start_connect(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  330:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  331:         = diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]),
  332:     {ok, TPid};
  333: start_connect(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  334:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  335: 
  336: %% start_accept/2
  337: 
  338: start_accept(Prot, Ref) ->
  339:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  340:         = start_accept(Prot, {accept, Ref}, ?SVC([?ADDR]), [{port, 0}]),
  341:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected})),
  342:     TPid.
  343: 
  344: start_accept(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  345:     diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]);
  346: start_accept(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  347:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  348: 
  349: %% ===========================================================================
  350: 
  351: %% gen_connect/2
  352: 
  353: gen_connect(sctp = P, PortNr) ->
  354:     {ok, Sock} = Ok = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  355:     ok = gen_sctp:connect_init(Sock, ?ADDR, PortNr, []),
  356:     Ok = gen_accept(P, Sock);
  357: gen_connect(tcp, PortNr) ->
  358:     gen_tcp:connect(?ADDR, PortNr, ?TCP_OPTS).
  359: 
  360: %% gen_listen/1
  361: 
  362: gen_listen(sctp) ->
  363:     {ok, Sock} = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  364:     {gen_sctp:listen(Sock, true), Sock};
  365: gen_listen(tcp) ->
  366:     gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip, ?ADDR} | ?TCP_OPTS]).
  367: 
  368: %% gen_accept/2
  369: 
  370: gen_accept(sctp, Sock) ->
  371:     #sctp_assoc_change{state = comm_up,
  372:                        outbound_streams = OS,
  373:                        inbound_streams = IS,
  374:                        assoc_id = Id}
  375:         = ?RECV(?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{} = S}), S),
  376: 
  377:     putr(assoc, {OS, IS, Id}),
  378:     {ok, Sock};
  379: gen_accept(tcp, LSock) ->
  380:     gen_tcp:accept(LSock).
  381: 
  382: %% gen_send/3
  383: 
  384: gen_send(sctp, Sock, Bin) ->
  385:     {OS, _IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  386:     gen_sctp:send(Sock, Id, erlang:unique_integer([positive]) rem OS, Bin);
  387: gen_send(tcp, Sock, Bin) ->
  388:     gen_tcp:send(Sock, Bin).
  389: 
  390: %% gen_recv/2
  391: 
  392: gen_recv(sctp, Sock) ->
  393:     {_OS, _IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  394:     receive
  395:         ?SCTP(Sock, {[#sctp_sndrcvinfo{assoc_id = I}], Bin})
  396:           when is_binary(Bin) ->
  397:             {Id, _} = {I, Id},  %% assert
  398:             Bin
  399:     end;
  400: gen_recv(tcp, Sock) ->
  401:     tcp_recv(Sock, <<>>).
  402: 
  403: tcp_recv(_, <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin)
  404:   when Len =< size(Bin) ->
  405:     Bin;
  406: tcp_recv(Sock, B) ->
  407:     receive {tcp, Sock, Bin} -> tcp_recv(Sock, <<B/binary, Bin/binary>>) end.
  408: 
  409: %% putr/2
  410: 
  411: putr(Key, Val) ->
  412:     put({?MODULE, Key}, Val).
  413: 
  414: %% getr/1
  415: 
  416: getr(Key) ->
  417:     get({?MODULE, Key}).
